paint.description: What does the Moses family do they aren't sure which shade of blue-grey to paint the dining room? Paint stripes! Seeing the color on a big patch of wall really helps you decide which one works best.  Or maybe we'll just leave it like that.
paint.title: Paint

phoebe1.description: This is Phoebe, a classmate of Felix.  Phoebe's mom, Laura, is another French-speaking mom. We've had a couple of playdates after school.
phoebe1.title: Phoebe 1

phoebe2.description: Phoebe is almost a whole year older than Felix. She takes her role of tribal elder seriously and teaches him stuff, like how to play card games.  Felix, by the way, has no clue about card games.
phoebe2.title: Phoebe 2

phoebe3.description:
Felix and Phoebe get along very well. Felix often asks if Phoebe can come and play, or if he can go to her house.

Felix also likes when Laura drops Phoebe off at school, because Laura usually stays to read a book. Friday, upon arriving at the Snuggery, Felix asked "Where Eebie mommy? Want Eebie mommy livre book." The boy likes his routines.
phoebe3.title: Phoebe 3

pool1.description: Olga, Dylan's mom, invited Lucie and Felix to a very nice swimming pool in San Rafael, the Anne Curtis Swim School. It is only open to members and their guests.
pool1.title: Pool 1

pool2.description: Dylan, Felix, Lucie and the Belly.
pool2.title: Pool 2

roll1.description: Lately, Felix is very much into his Papa. He just can't get enough of him. He showers him with hugs and "Love you"s.
roll1.title: Roll 1

roll2.description: Oh, oh, Papa, are we going for a ride again?
roll2.title: Roll 2

roll5.description: Felix is concerned about his potential Papa abuse, but Dean's developed a hard head.
roll5.title: Roll 5

description:
This has been a weekend of adrenaline-pumping entertainment for Felix.

On Saturday he went to the movies for the very first time. We saw Shrek 2. It has an ogre in it! Scary! We munched a hotdog and fought for control of the popcorn bag throughout the show. Felix enjoyed it, though he did find the loud sound, the darkness, and the humongous screen a bit intimidating. He stayed curled up in Dean's lap the entire time.

On Sunday, the 4th of July, Felix saw his first fireworks. We knew he was going to be scared, because he had pretended to watch fireworks earlier in the day and he pretended he was scared by them then. At the actual thing, he was both in awe and sort of scared ("peur! peur!"), and stayed burrowed in a blanket in Dean's arms. The show was in Oakland, and Dean and Lucie were delighted with it: after years of colored fogs in San Francisco, it felt great to see some real fireworks under clear skies. Hooray for the East Bay!
title: July 5
